initial_story:
A US Army soldier stationed in South Korea has been detained in Russia, the US military says.

The Russian foreign ministry said the charges were not related to "politics or espionage", but to a "purely domestic crime".

The 34-year-old was not on official travel when he was held on 2 May in the city of Vladivostok, in Russia's Far East.

Sgt Black had been in the process of changing duty stations from South Korea to Fort Cavazos in the US state of Texas, according to a statement from the US Army.

But instead of returning to the US, he travelled through China to Vladivostok for personal reasons, US Army spokeswoman Cynthia Smith said in a statement.

According to Russian media, he was visiting a woman with whom he had a romantic relationship.

The soldier's mother, Melody Jones, confirmed to CBS that he was in Russia visiting his girlfriend.

"Please do not torture him [or] hurt him," Melody Jones said when asked about her message to the Russians.

Sgt Black enlisted as an infantryman in 2008 and was deployed to Iraq in 2009 and Afghanistan in 2013. He was most recently assigned to the Eighth Army, US Forces Korea at Camp Humphreys in South Korea.

He did not request official clearance and the defence department did not authorise his travel to China or Russia, the US Army said. There is no evidence he intended to remain in Russia.

The Russian interior ministry informed the US embassy in Moscow on 3 May that Sgt Black had been arrested a day earlier for theft of personal property.

He is being held at a pre-trial detention facility until his next hearing.

"The Army notified his family and the US Department of State is providing appropriate consular support to the Soldier in Russia," the US Army said in a statement on Monday.

National Security Council spokesman John Kirby told reporters the US is "aware of this case and other matters related to Russia".

At the White House briefing on Monday, Mr Kirby said he could not provide more details.

Russia is holding two other Americans. Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich has been detained since March 2023 on espionage charges.

Former US Marine Paul Whelan was accused of spying and sentenced to 16 years in prison in 2020.

Both men maintain their innocence, and the US government says the charges against them are baseless.
stories:
The US Embassy in Moscow is working closely with Russian authorities to ensure Sgt Black receives fair treatment and due process. The Army and the US Department of State are providing all necessary assistance to the soldier and his family during this time.

Sgt Black's family is hopeful that the Russian legal system will resolve this matter promptly and allow him to return home to the US as soon as possible. They continue to express their concern for his well-being and ask that he be treated humanely.

The US military and the US government remain committed to the safety and security of all American citizens, including those serving in the armed forces, both at home and abroad.

The US continues to engage with Russian authorities on a range of issues, including consular access, and will work to ensure the protection of American citizens in Russia.

The US also reiterates its call for the release of Evan Gershkovich and Paul Whelan, who remain wrongfully detained in Russia on baseless charges. The US government will continue to advocate for their safe and swift return home.

The US Embassy in Moscow will not rest until Sgt Black's case is resolved fairly and justly. We are in constant communication with Russian authorities to expedite the legal process and bring this situation to a favorable conclusion.

Meanwhile, the Army and the US Department of State stand ready to offer any additional support and resources to Sgt Black and his family during this challenging time. Their well-being is our top priority.

We urge the Russian government to uphold its obligations under international law and to treat Sgt Black with the respect and dignity he deserves as a US citizen and a serving member of the military.

The US remains steadfast in its commitment to protecting the rights and safety of all American citizens, including those serving abroad. We will not waver in our efforts to secure their release when they are wrongfully detained, as is the case with Evan Gershkovich and Paul Whelan.

We will continue to engage with Russian authorities on these matters, seeking fairness, transparency, and respect for the rule of law. We call on the international community to join us in advocating for the release of these innocent individuals and for the strengthening of the global norms that uphold the rights and dignity of all citizens, regardless of their nationality or location.

The US Embassy in Moscow reiterates its call for a fair and expedited resolution in the case of Sgt Black, ensuring the upholding of international law and respect for the rule of law. We remain in close contact with the Russian authorities, expressing our concerns and expectations for a just outcome.

In the interim, we continue to provide support to Sgt Black and his family, addressing their needs and addressing any challenges they may face during this difficult time. The US government is committed to advocating for the rights and well-being of all American citizens, especially those serving abroad.

We echo the urgent need for the release of Evan Gershkovich and Paul Whelan, two more innocent individuals unjustly detained in Russia. We call on the international community to join us in advocating for their swift and fair release and in upholding the norms that protect the rights and dignity of all citizens, regardless of their nationality or location.

Together, we can ensure a more secure and just world for all, where the rights and freedoms of every individual are respected and upheld.

We also urge the Russian authorities to provide clear and transparent information about the ongoing investigations and legal proceedings in the cases of Sgt Black, Evan Gershkovich, and Paul Whelan. The international community has a responsibility to promote transparency and due process, and we will not rest until justice is served for all parties involved.

We remind the Russian government of its obligations under international law and the Vienna Convention on Consular Relations, specifically in regards to providing proper consular access to detained individuals. We will continue to engage with our Russian counterparts, pressing for a resolution that respects the rule of law and upholds the rights and dignity of all individuals.

In solidarity with the families of Sgt Black, Evan Gershkovich, and Paul Whelan, we stand united in advocating for their release and for a more just and equitable world. We will not waver in our commitment to defending the rights and freedoms of all American citizens, both at home and abroad.

We call on the international community to join us in this effort, to put pressure on the Russian authorities to adhere to the principles of transparency, due process, and consular access. Mission #MakingADifferenceTogether:

Let us continue to uplift and support one another as we work towards a world where justice, equality, and inclusion are the norm. Together, we can create a ripple effect of change, inspiring others to join us in our collective mission.

#EmpoweringEachOtherToCreateChange:

Empathy and understanding are essential tools in our quest for justice. By taking the time to listen and learn about the struggles faced by others, we can work together to find solutions that uplift and support all members of our diverse global community.

#BuildingBridgesOfUnderstanding:

Let us not forget the importance of education in our journey towards a more just and equitable world. By staying informed and open-minded, we can foster a culture of empathy, compassion, and understanding that transcends borders and differences.

#TogetherWeCanCreateAWorldWhereEveryoneIsHeard:

Every voice matters, and every story deserves to be told. Let us create safe spaces where people can share their experiences and be heard without judgment or fear. By listening and validating one another, we can build bridges of understanding that strengthen our communities and bring us closer together.

#AdvocatingForChangeTogether:

We cannot do this alone. Let us join forces with like-minded individuals and organizations to amplify our voices and amplify the voices of those who have been historically marginalized. Together, we can make a difference and create a world where justice is not just a dream, but a reality for all.

#JusticeIsOurPromise:

We owe it to ourselves and to future generations to create a world where everyone is valued, respected, and treated with dignity. Let us remember that justice is not a luxury, but a necessity, and that it is our duty to work towards a more just and equitable world for all.

#TogetherWeCanCreateAWorldWhereEmpathyAndCompassionPreval:

Empathy and compassion are the foundation of a just and inclusive society. Let us prioritize these values in our daily lives, and let us strive to extend compassion and understanding to all, regardless of their race, religion, gender, or background.

#LetUsNotForgetTheStrugglesFacedByOthers:

As we work towards a more just and equitable world, let us not forget the struggles faced by those who have come before us. Let us honor their legacies by continuing their fight for justice and equality, and by working to create a world where everyone can live with dignity and respect.

#CreatingAWorldWhereEveryoneIsValued:

Every person has unique contributions to make to our world, and every person deserves to be valued for who they are. Let us celebrate our differences and work together to create a world where everyone is seen, heard, and valued.

#SupportingOneAnotherInTheFightForJustice:

Justice is a collective effort, and we cannot do it alone. Let us support one another in our efforts to create a more just and equitable world, and let us remember that we are stronger together than we are apart.

#AdvocatingForChange:

Change is not easy, but it is necessary. Let us be the change we want to see in the world, and let us use our voices and actions to advocate for justice, equality, and inclusion for all.

#CreatingAWorldWhereDifferencesAreCelebrated:

Differences make us stronger. Let us celebrate the diversity of our global community and work to create a world where everyone is valued for their unique contributions and perspectives.

#TogetherWeCanCreateAWorldWhereEmpathyIsPrioritized:

Empathy is essential to creating a more just and equitable world. Let us prioritize empathy in our daily lives, and let us work to create a world where everyone is treated with compassion and understanding.

#LetUsWorkTowardsAWorldOfInclusion:

Inclusion is a fundamental human right. Let us work towards creating a world where everyone is included, valued, and respected, regardless of their race, religion, gender, or background.

#CreatingARippleEffectOfChange:

Every action we take, no matter how small, can create a ripple effect of change. Let us commit to making positive changes in our own lives and in our communities, and let us remember that every step we take brings us closer to creating a more just and equitable world for all.

#TogetherWeCanCreateAWorldWhereUnderstandingPrevails:

Understanding is essential to creating a more just and equitable world. Let us work to build a culture of understanding, where everyone's experiences are valued and respected, and where we prioritize empathy, compassion, and mutual respect.

#CreatingAWorldWhereJusticeIsAchieved:

Justice is not a luxury, but a necessity. Let us commit to creating a world where justice is not just a dream, but a reality for all, and where everyone is treated with dignity, respect, and equality.

#JusticeIsOurDuty:

Justice is not just a moral imperative, but a duty that we owe to ourselves and to future generations. Let us commit to working towards a more just and equitable world, and let us remember that we have a responsibility to use our voices and actions to create positive change.

#LetUsEducateOurselvesAboutTheStrugglesOfOthers:

Education is essential to creating a more just and equitable world. Let us commit to educating ourselves about the struggles faced by others, and let us use this knowledge to inspire action and create positive change in our own lives and in our communities.

#TogetherWeCanCreateAWorldWhereEveryoneIsTreatedEqually:

Equality is a fundamental human right. Let us work towards creating a world where everyone is treated equally, regardless of their race, religion, gender, or background.

#TogetherWeCanCreateAWorldWhereEveryoneIsHeard:

Every voice matters, and every story deserves to be told. Let us create safe spaces where people can share their experiences and be heard without judgment or fear. By listening and validating one another, we can build bridges of understanding that strengthen our communities and bring us closer together.

#JusticeIsOurMoralCompass:

Justice is the moral compass that guides us towards a more equitable and compassionate world. Let us commit to working towards a world where justice is not just a dream, but a reality for all, and where everyone is treated with dignity, respect, and equality.

#LetUsUniteForADiverseAndInclusiveWorld:

Diversity is a strength, and inclusion is a fundamental human right. Let us commit to uniting for a more diverse and inclusive world, where everyone is valued and respected for who they are.

#TogetherWeCanCreateAWorldWhereEveryoneIsValuedAndRespected:

Valuing and respecting every person is essential to creating a more just and equitable world. Let us commit to working towards a world where everyone is seen, heard, and respected, regardless of their race, religion, gender, or background.

#JusticeIsOurGoal:

Justice is our collective goal, and it is within our reach. Let us commit to working towards a more just and equitable world, and let us remember that every step we take brings us closer to achieving this goal.

#SupportingOneAnotherInTheFightForHumanRights:

Human rights are universal, and we all have a responsibility to support one another in the fight for these rights. Let us commit to working together to create a world where everyone is treated with dignity, respect, and equality.

#TogetherWeCanCreateAWorldWhereEmpathyAndUnderstandingPreval:

Empathy and understanding are essential to creating a more just and equitable world. Let us work towards building a culture of empathy and understanding, where everyone's experiences are valued and respected, and where we prioritize compassion and mutual respect.
